config_onion_service: Setting up onion service on port {0:d}.
wait_for_hs: Waiting for HS to be ready:
give_this_url: Give this address to the recipient of the file:
give_this_url_stealth: Give this address and HidServAuth line to the recipient of the file:
give_this_url_receive: Give this address to those that send you files:
give_this_url_receive_stealth: Give this address and your HidServAuth line to those that send you files:
ctrlc_to_stop: Press Ctrl+C to stop the server
no_available_port: Could not start the onion service without a port to do it on.
large_filesize: Warning: Sending large files could take hours
error_tails_invalid_port: Wrong value, "Port" must be a regular number
error_tails_unknown_root: Unknown error with Tails root process
systray_download_completed_message: The user has your files now
help_local_only: Do not attempt to use Tor: For development only
help_stay_open: Keep onion service running after OnionShare is completed
help_shutdown_timeout: Close onion service after a given amount of seconds
help_receive: Set your onion to reception instead of OnionSharing
help_debug: Log OnionShare errors to stdout, and log web errors to disk
help_filename: List of files or folders to OnionShare
help_config: Location of custom JSON config file (optional)
gui_drag_and_drop:
Drag and drop files and folders
to start OnionSharing
error_hs_dir_not_writable: Onion service dir {0:s} is write protected
using_ephemeral: Starting ephemeral Tor onion service and awaiting publication
gui_quit_warning: Quitting now means files underway won't finish.
error_rate_limit: Too many guesses means someone could be trying to work out the address of your files. OnionSharing has stopped. Start it again and send the new address to share them.
error_stealth_not_supported: To create onion services, you need at least Tor 0.2.9.1-alpha (or Tor Browser 6.5) and at least python3-stem 1.5.0.
error_ephemeral_not_supported: OnionShare requires at least Tor 0.2.7.1 and at least python3-stem 1.4.0.
gui_settings_stealth_option: Create onion services that are stealthy
gui_settings_stealth_option_details:
This is more secure, but also more difficult to connect to.
More info.
gui_settings_stealth_hidservauth_string:
Having saved your private key for reuse, means you can now
click to copy your HidServAuth.
gui_settings_autoupdate_option: Notify me when a new version is available
gui_settings_connection_type_label: How should OnionShare connect to Tor?
gui_settings_connection_type_bundled_opt: Use the Tor version built into OnionShare
gui_settings_tor_bridges_obfs4_radio_opt: Use built-in obfs4 pluggable transports (requires obfs4proxy)
gui_settings_tor_bridges_meek_lite_azure: Use built-in meek_lite (Azure) pluggable transports (requires obfs4proxy)
gui_settings_meek_lite_expensive_warning:
Warning: The meek_lite bridges are very costly for the Tor Project to run.

Only use them if unable to connect to Tor directly, via obfs4 transports or other normal bridges.
gui_settings_tor_bridges_invalid:
None of your bridges work.
Double-checking them or add others.
settings_error_unknown: Can't connect to Tor controller because the settings don't make sense.
settings_error_automatic:
Could not connect to the Tor controller. The Tor Browser (available from https://www.torproject.org/)
needs to be running in the background.
settings_error_socket_port: Can't connect to Tor controller on {}:{}.
settings_error_socket_file: Can't connect to Tor controller using the socket file {}.
settings_error_auth: Connected to {}:{}, but can't authenticate. Maybe this isn't a Tor controller?
settings_error_missing_password: Connected to Tor controller, type in the password to authenticate.
settings_error_unreadable_cookie_file: Connected to the Tor controller, but can't authenticate. Maybe your password is wrong, or your user lacks permission to read the cookie file?
settings_error_bundled_tor_not_supported: Useing the Tor version that comes with OnionShare does not work in developer mode on Windows or macOS.
settings_error_bundled_tor_timeout: Connecting to Tor is taking too long. Maybe your computer is offline, or your system clock isn't accurate?
settings_error_bundled_tor_canceled: The Tor process closed before a connection was established.
settings_error_bundled_tor_broken:
OnionShare could not connect to Tor in the background:
{}
settings_test_success:
Connected to the Tor controller.

Tor version: {}
Supports ephemeral onion services: {}.
Supports onion services that are stealthy: {}.
error_tor_protocol_error:
Could not communicate with the Tor controller.
If you are using Whonix, check out https://www.whonix.org/wiki/onionshare to make OnionShare work.
update_available:
New version of OnionShare. Click here to get it.

You have {} and the latest is {}.
update_error_check_error: Could not check for new versions: Maybe you're not connected to Tor, or the OnionShare website is down?
update_error_invalid_latest_version: Could not check for new versions: The OnionShare website is saying the latest version is the unrecognizable '{}'…
update_not_available: You are running the latest OnionShare.
gui_tor_connection_ask: Would you like to open the settings to troubleshoot connecting to Tor?
gui_tor_connection_error_settings: Try changing how OnionShare connects to the Tor network in the settings.
gui_tor_connection_canceled:
Could not connect to Tor.

Ensure you are connected to the Internet, then re-open OnionShare and set up its connection to Tor.
gui_server_started_after_timeout:
The expiry timer ran out before the server started.
Please start a new share.
gui_server_timeout_expired:
The expiry timer ran out.
Please restart it to start sharing.
gui_save_private_key_checkbox:
Use a persistent address
(unchecking will delete any saved addresses)
gui_url_description: Anyone with this OnionShare address your files using the Tor Browser:
gui_url_label_persistent:
This share will not expire automatically unless a timer is set.

Every subsequent share will be available at the same address (to use one-time addresses, turn off "Persistence" in the settings)
gui_url_label_stay_open: Add a timer to automatically expire the share.
gui_url_label_onetime: This OnionShare expires after one OnionSharing
gui_url_label_onetime_and_persistent:
This OnionShare expires after completion

Every subsequent OnionShare will be available at the same OnionShare address (to use one-time addresses, turn off "Persistence" in the settings)
receive_mode_downloads_dir: Files sent to you appear in this folder: {}
receive_mode_warning: Warning: Some files can take control of your computer if you open them! Only open files from people you trust to know what they are doing.
